speaker: Doctor
text: Can you describe when you first noticed the weakness and decreased sensation in your right arm?

speaker: Patient
text: I first noticed the weakness a few weeks ago, and it has been getting worse since then. The decreased sensation started around the same time, and it's really concerning.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any pain or discomfort in your neck or shoulder area along with the weakness and decreased sensation?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes, I've been feeling a dull aching and burning pain in my right arm. It sometimes radiates up to my shoulder, but it's mostly concentrated in my arm.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent injuries or trauma to your neck, shoulder, or arm that could explain these symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't had any recent injuries or trauma. The weakness and pain just seemed to come on gradually without any specific incident.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your coordination or balance since the symptoms began?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't noticed any changes in my coordination or balance. My balance seems to be fine, but the weakness in my arm is really affecting my ability to do things.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any numbness or tingling in other parts of your body, such as your fingers or hand?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes, I've noticed some tingling in my fingers on the right hand, especially when I try to grip things. It feels like my hand is not fully awake sometimes.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent illnesses, infections, or fevers that could be related to these symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't had any recent illnesses or fevers. I feel generally fine aside from the issues with my arm.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your bowel or bladder function since the onset of your symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't noticed any changes in my bowel or bladder function. Everything seems normal in that regard.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any history of neurological conditions or any family history of similar symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: I don't have any personal history of neurological conditions, and as far as I know, there's no family history of similar symptoms either. This is all quite new to me.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any weakness or changes in sensation in your other arm or legs?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't noticed any weakness or changes in sensation in my left arm or legs. It's really just my right arm that's been affected.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any headaches, dizziness, or visual disturbances since the symptoms began?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't experienced any headaches, dizziness, or visual disturbances. My vision and overall balance feel normal. It's just the issues with my right arm that are troubling me.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent imaging studies, such as an MRI or CT scan of your neck or brain, to evaluate for any structural issues?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't had any recent imaging studies done. I haven't seen a doctor about this yet, so I'm not sure if that's something I need.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your grip strength or ability to perform fine motor tasks with your right hand?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes, I've definitely noticed a decrease in my grip strength. It's becoming harder to hold onto things, and tasks that require fine motor skills, like buttoning my shirt, are getting really difficult.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any episodes of dizziness or fainting, even if they are unrelated to your arm symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't experienced any dizziness or fainting episodes. I feel stable in that regard, but the weakness in my arm is really concerning me.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your skin temperature or color in your right arm compared to your left arm?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't really noticed any significant changes in skin temperature or color between my right and left arms. They seem to look and feel about the same to me.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any recent stress or changes in your lifestyle that might be contributing to these symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: I've been under some stress lately, especially with work and personal issues. My lifestyle hasn't changed much otherwise, but I guess the stress could be playing a role.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent blood tests done, particularly to check for vitamin deficiencies or autoimmune markers?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't had any recent blood tests done. I haven't thought about checking for vitamin deficiencies or autoimmune issues, but it might be a good idea.

speaker: Doctor
text: REQUEST TEST: Blood_Test_Vitamin_Deficiencies_Autoimmune_Markers. Have you noticed any changes in your sleep patterns or energy levels since the onset of your symptoms?

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your sleep patterns or energy levels since the onset of your symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: I've noticed that my energy levels have been lower than usual, and I feel more fatigued throughout the day. My sleep patterns haven't changed much, but I do feel more restless at night.

speaker: Doctor
text: It sounds like your fatigue could be related to the stress you've mentioned. Have you experienced any recent weight loss or gain that might be associated with these changes in energy levels?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes, I've actually lost about 17 pounds recently without trying. It's been quite sudden and a bit alarming for me.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your appetite or eating habits that might explain the weight loss?

speaker: Patient
text: I've noticed that my appetite has decreased quite a bit. I just don't feel as hungry as I used to, and I find myself skipping meals more often.

speaker: Doctor
text: Maximum inferences reached

speaker: Patient
text: I've been feeling really concerned about these symptoms. It's frustrating not knowing what's causing all of this.
